data.title: TextEditor.getPath only providing realpath
data.body:
Currently `TextEditor.getPath` returns the realpath of the file. When a project directory contains symlinks somewhere under it it becomes impossible to decide which project root a specific file belongs to. Please see noseglid/atom-build#245 for a longer explanation of the use case as well as an example folder hierarchy.

The only way to make a correlation between a TextEditor and a project root requires the TextEditor to provide the non-real path of the file.

Getting the realpath from the non-real path is trivial (`fs.realpath())`) but the other way around is simply not possible.

data.title: Avoid infinite recursion in Error.prepareStackTrace
data.body:
Refs #9660

Previously, prepareStackTraceWithStackAssignment could end up calling itself when third-party code assigned Error.prepareStackTrace back to its original value. Now, we short-circuit this process if the rawStack property has already been assigned.

:pear:d on this with @maxbrunsfeld.

![Preview](http://i.imgur.com/2dr3iXd.png)

data.title: Moving a folder in the Tree View does not close the corresponding file buffers.
data.body:
When dragging a file in the Tree View into a different folder, any buffers of this file are closed. I guess, this is desired behaviour. (Alternatively, the buffer could stay open and internally change the file it is referring to, but this is another topic.)

However, the behaviour is different when instead of a file a whole folder is moved (via drag and drop) in the Tree View: Buffers of files in the folder stay open, and upon closing them manually, a dialogue "file.xyz has changes, do you want to save them?" is triggered. This is certainly not good behaviour. The buffers should be closed instead.

Furthermore, if the file is not yet added to git, it is marked green in the Tree View, along with all higher level folders. If now a folder with such a new file is moved, the green marking does not update properly for the higher level folders.

Using:
atom 1.2.4
tree-view 0.195.0
ubuntu 14.04

data.title: smb MyCloud files not opened correctly under 64-bit Ubuntu 15.10
data.body: This appears to be a Linux specific bug. Test system is quad-core I7 with 16Gig of RAM running Ubuntu 15.10 with all updates applied. Atom is installed from the wily main PPA so it stays relatively current automatically. Share device is a Western Digital MyCloud 4TB device. Same machine booting 64-bit Windows 7 Pro with Atom has no problem opening text files on the drive. On Ubuntu I can double click a text file and gedit opens it fine. If I right click on to-do.txt and select "open with atom" atom comes up, it displays the file name on top, but an empty tab. Editing files with all other text editors works fine. It appears Atom is doing something incorrectly for smb mounted shares under Ubuntu 15.10.

data.title: Default font size reset / deleted after command window:reset-font-size

Hello everyone im not really sure if this is a bug or not.

In my config.cson i have fontSize setup to 11 and on the settings section as well on 11.

The problem now is when im zooming in in the editor, and press cmd-0 to call the reset-font-size command i would suggest to have my font size reseted to 11 again (my default font size) but instead it is reseted to 14 i think and on the config.cson my fontSize 11 is gone as well on the settings section.

T think this was working before (don't know when it broke).

data.title: [find-and-replace] The option "Open project find results in right pane" is not always respected
data.body:
If I perform a project-level find the results pane gets opened at the right side, since I've set the "Open project find results in right pane" option "on" in the settings. No matter if I have some other tabs open or not. So far so good.

The problem comes if I have something at the left and the results pane at the right: if I close everything at the left, now that there's nothing more, the results pane expands to fit the whole space.

I believe this shouldn't happen since when there are no tabs the results pane is still opened at the right, leaving nothing at its left.

I'm using Atom Beta v1.3.0-beta0

data.title: Custom test runner using Mocha and Coverage
data.body:
I'm trying to use [Mocha](mochajs.org) for Atom package specs and have hit several obstacles in my way.

The ultimate goal of this is to achieve test coverage for package specs using [coffee-coverage](https://github.com/benbria/coffee-coverage). And I just prefer Mocha over Jasmine in general.

Using custom test runner (#8968) with the following `atomTestRunner` file:

https://gist.github.com/mrodalgaard/8961e8760e6c408350f9
- [x] **Spec window does not open in devMode**
  Opened spec window when using `Window:Run Package Specs` starts in non-development mode even though Atom is in development mode. So I have to force it into devMode by redirecting the url - very ugly. Setting devMode on `applicationDelegate` did nothing and setting devMode on the atom global seems to be too late for package load paths (`packages.packageDirPaths`).
  --- Fixed in #9476 ---
- [x] **Package using activationCommands does not activate**
  Currently I'm just testing this on the [default package](https://github.com/atom/package-generator) modified for Mocha and Chai expect. The problem is that the `activatePackage` promise never resolves even though the package seems to load. This works with Jasmine without the custom test runner. And when I remove `activationCommands` from package.json it resolves and Mocha runs the tests successfully.
  --- Fixed by not returning a promise in Mocha's beforeEach ---

``` coffee
beforeEach ->
  workspaceElement = atom.views.getView(atom.workspace)
  # With activationCommands this never resolves
  activationPromise = atom.packages.activatePackage('demo-package')
```
- [x] **Content Security Policy on 'unsafe-eval'**
  [coffee-coverage](https://github.com/benbria/coffee-coverage) ultimately fails on eval because the spec window is opened with restrictive Content-Security-Policy. [electron issue](https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/3430) and [atom PR](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/1702) mentions this, but I could not see how `allowUnsafeEval` could be set by the developer.
  --- Fixed by using [loophole package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loophole) even though is feels like a hack ---
- [ ] **Coverage runs, but reports 0%**
  Files that are wrapped by coverage (Esprima and Escodegen) are apparently not the ones being run by Atom or a child process is spawned before tests run like hinted to [here](https://github.com/benbria/coffee-coverage/issues/60).

Using Mac OSX 10.11.1, Atom 1.2.4 and Atom 1.3.0-beta6.

Apologize for the long post, but I felt it all belonged here to get the full picture.

data.title: Capturing errors always runs `apm ls --json --no-color` and renders atom unusable for an amount of time
data.body:
Everytime an error dialog is shown:

![screen shot 2015-11-28 at 13 54 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/927609/11451960/91e00a5c-95d7-11e5-95be-4077a3bfe44a.png)

Atom runs `apm ls --json --no-color` producing this profile

![screen shot 2015-11-28 at 13 55 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/927609/11451963/b3b1f4e2-95d7-11e5-9129-cead20ff82e2.png)

![screen shot 2015-11-28 at 13 58 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/927609/11451975/20a8ce54-95d8-11e5-8934-e17708265a2d.png)

It renders atom unusable for about a minute or so (using 100% cpu for handling `apm ls --json --no-color`'s output, which is only **10mb**)

Also clicking the reporting button has no effect until atom finishes this process.

It could be one reason for https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3426

I tried to find the code that runs `apm ls --json --no-color`, but unsuccessful.
## Versions
- **Atom:**       1.3.0-beta6
- **Atom-Shell:** 
- **OS:**         Mac OS X 10.10.5
- **Misc**
  - apm  1.1.1
  - npm  2.13.3
  - node 0.10.40
  - python 2.7.10
  - git 2.5.1

data.title: A pane is still visible when closing its last tab. Bug or correct behaviour?
data.body:
I'm using Atom Beta v1.3.0-beta6 on Mac OS X 10.11.1, but I'm actually getting the same results on Atom v1.2.3

1) I split the editor area in two panes by choosing VIEW -> PANES -> SPLIT UP:

![panes_e_view_e_menubar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/605017/11451228/f9137c00-95bd-11e5-8e24-18e38ddded31.jpg)

2) Then I close the only tab opened on the lower pane ("index.jade"):

![index_jade_-__users_scala_documents_progetti_progetti_html-css_promo_allascala_it_-_atom 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/605017/11451230/158a521e-95be-11e5-8a6b-fde11918290b.jpg)

3) The lower pane then is still visible, even if it's empty:

![_users_scala_documents_progetti_progetti_html-css_promo_allascala_it_-_atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/605017/11451237/3dc54a22-95be-11e5-8f90-6ee715bd60e4.jpg)

This is the log taken from console.app :

```
28/11/15 10:06:17,642   Atom[770]   App load time: 1211ms
28/11/15 10:06:39,212   Atom[770]   BUG in libdispatch client: kevent[EVFILT_MEMORYSTATUS] add: "Operation not supported" - 0x2d
28/11/15 10:06:40,301   Atom[770]   assertion failed: 15B42: libxpc.dylib + 79134 [3E09C275-A33B-357A-B0AB-A2DDF88EC9D5]: 0x89
28/11/15 10:19:15,243   Atom[909]   App load time: 1536ms
28/11/15 10:19:40,495   Atom[950]   App load time: 363ms
28/11/15 10:23:19,103   Atom[983]   App load time: 2064ms
28/11/15 10:27:02,212   Atom[1031]  App load time: 350ms
28/11/15 10:35:24,418   Atom[1031]  BUG in libdispatch client: kevent[EVFILT_MEMORYSTATUS] add: "Operation not supported" - 0x2d
28/11/15 10:35:24,574   Atom[1031]  assertion failed: 15B42: libxpc.dylib + 79134 [3E09C275-A33B-357A-B0AB-A2DDF88EC9D5]: 0x89
28/11/15 10:35:29,070   Atom[1031]  Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
28/11/15 10:35:29,075   Atom[1031]  TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at AtomApplication.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:608:40)
    at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.openPaths (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:613:10)

28/11/15 10:36:51,594   Atom[1076]  App load time: 353ms
```

If I want to close the empty pane I have to select VIEW -> PANES -> CLOSE PANE from the dropdown menu.

May I ask you if this a bug or the normal behaviour of Atom?

If this is the correct behaviour in this case, may I say that IMHO it would be more intuitive to expect that when you close the last tab in a pane, that pane would disappear.

Thank you for reading my message and best regards

data.title: Fix #9806 small issue in scrollbar component
data.body: This fix the issue #9806 [Small issue with scroll position]. Since the scrollTop is always 0 when the element is `display: none`, we need to update the visibility of the element before we update the scrollTop.
